discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The schedule and resource assumptions in the project plan capture the basis for planned durations, resource allocations, and cost estimates. If a project is consistently lagging in CPI and SPI, it indicates issues with how time and resources were initially allocated. The risk manager should review these assumptions to identify discrepancies between the plan and actual performance, then adjust the plan to mitigate further overruns.

questions.question_text:
A project has consistently been lagging in cost performance index (CPI) and schedule performance index (SPI) over the past few months. The risk manager realizes that some activities are taking longer than expected and more resources are needed.

Which project artifact should the risk manager analyze to mitigate the risk of further project overrun?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Improving collaboration during risk planning is crucial, especially when team members and stakeholders are distributed across multiple time zones and may not have worked together previously. A start-up workshop can be an effective way to align everyone at the beginning of the project, establish communication norms, and foster collaboration. If colocation is possible, it further improves collaboration by allowing team members to engage more directly, build relationships, and address risks together in real time.

choices.C: Communicate program metrics to all parties and create a scorecard to measure the effectiveness.
choices.A: Work with the project manager to develop a start-up workshop and colocate the team if permitted.
choices.D: Gather risk information from all parties and compile all submissions into a strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats (SWOT) analysis template.
choices.B: Create a repository for project documents and related artifacts that can be accessed by all parties.

The correct answer is: D. Timely, cost-effective, agreed-upon, and accepted.

The goal of a stakeholder meeting to discuss project risk response strategies is to reach consensus on a course of action that is timely, cost-effective, agreed-upon by all parties, and accepted as the best course of action for addressing the identified risks. It is important for the risk response strategies to be agreed-upon by all stakeholders to ensure that they are effectively implemented and to avoid conflicts or misunderstandings. It is also important for the strategies to be accepted by all stakeholders, as this will help to ensure their commitment to carrying out the agreed-upon actions and achieving the desired risk management outcomes.

questions.question_text:
Many customers using the global positioning system (GPS) of several automobile companies are complaining about errors due to a recent update. This update included a major technological change to mitigate emerging risks with software deployment. Upon investigation, the risk manager realized that this issue was identified as a high-risk item during risk analysis, which required secondary risk identification that was never completed.

What was missed in the risk management process that led to this incident?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The key element that was missed in the risk management process was the quality assurance of the strategy, which includes ensuring that all aspects of the risk management plan, including secondary risks, were properly identified, monitored, and controlled. If the project had undergone effective quality assurance (such as regular audits or reviews), it might have been caught that secondary risks were not being addressed properly, including the issues arising from the software update.

choices.A: The risk management strategy quality assurance.
choices.D: The new technology’s impact on existing controls
choices.B: The identification of the business driver.
